sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import '../styles/trends.css'; const Trends = () => { const trendingTopics = [ { id: 1, topic: '#WebDevelopment', posts: 1234, trending: 'up' }, { id: 2, topic: '#ReactJS', posts: 987, trending: 'up' }, { id: 3, topic: '#JavaScript', posts: 756, trending: 'down' }, { id: 4, topic: '#CSS', posts: 543, trending: 'up' }, { id: 5, topic: '#Programming', posts: 432, trending: 'up' } ]; const trendingPosts = [ { id: 1, user: { name: 'John Doe', avatar: 'https://via.placeholder.com/40x40' }, content: 'Just discovered an amazing new React hook! This is going to change everything. #ReactJS #WebDevelopment', time: '1 hour ago', likes: 156, comments: 23 }, { id: 2, user: { name: 'Jane Smith', avatar: 'https://via.placeholder.com/40x40' }, content: 'CSS Grid vs Flexbox - which one do you prefer? I\'m team Grid all the way! #CSS #WebDevelopment', time: '3 hours ago', likes: 89, comments: 45 } ]; return (

Trending Topics

See what's happening around the world

Trending Hashtags

{trendingTopics.map((topic) => (

{topic.topic}

{topic.posts.toLocaleString()} posts

))}

Trending Posts

{trendingPosts.map((post) => (

{post.user.name}

{post.time}

{post.content}

{post.likes} likes {post.comments} comments
))}
); }; export default Trends;
